intro: Pilosella laxipes, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pilosella laxipes is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
